data.title: Sports barish!
data.text: Clive's has free popcorn, cold beer and HH prices on apps!! Great endamme!! Good bar area, daily specials.  My favorite is the fish & chips or the slow roasted pot roast.  Busy from 4p-7p, after that crowd thins out.  Lots of TVs and a sports bar feel.

data.title: Clives close to Super Rink
data.text: A couple blocks from the Super rink in Blaine.  Decent food, cold beer, good waitstaff.  Happened to be there during a Vikings game.  Place was packed, lots of tv's, along with a DJ to announce games and prizes.  Saw a couple of fans win jerseys.  Once game was over, staff was quick to clean and set up for the next rush of customers.  Would definitely go there again.

data.title: Fish and chips
data.text: We really enjoy Cleves I usually like to order the fish and chips and my Wife loves the Cobb salad sometimes we play the pull tabs. Many TV'S to watch nicely decorated warm environment great staff daily specials you can't go wrong ordering

data.title: Food is expensive and small portions
data.text:
I now know why they offer free popcorn..to fill you up so you won' be hungry from the food portions.  Clive's used to have really amazing food.  It's now very average and expensive.  Even the happy hour isn't much of a value.  I think they make their money off of the soccer families from the Sports Arena who don't know better.  

Staff is not friendly and management is very arrogant.  I usually go here about twice a year...and everytime I leave I remember why I don't like it here.  There are many other options in Blaine rather than Clive's.

data.title: Always a great choice
data.text: We have Clives on our list of ALWAYS good spots. You can never go wrong with anything on the menu. Some of our favs are the blackened shrimp dip, the cheese curds, the Italian melt and the Cobb salad. They have daily specials that are a nice change too. Service is fast and accurate.

data.title: Great 1st visit, service was awesome and food excellent!
data.text: This was our first visit to this restaurant. We have to say that this was one of the best places we have been to in years. Our server McKenna was very awesome, very friendly, kind and courteous. She gave us great service, checked on us frequently and offered her comments when we asked her about the menu. The food itself was excellent, presented very well and was very hot and tasty. The dining room atmosphere was very unique, there were alot of larger parties present but there wasn't alot of noise. There were several tv's in the dining area but the sound was turned off. What a great place and we can't wait to stop back and or try another one of your locations!

data.title: Just too many negatives
data.text: I would have really liked to give this a good review. The atmosphere is great and our server was wonderful. It would be great for drinks after work, especially on their patio. However, the food left a lot to be desired. My wife ordered soup and a half sandwich. They brought the wrong sandwich. They replaced it with the right sandwich but neglected to toast it as requested. My sandwich was fairly tasteless. My son's sandwich, the Cuban, barely had any meat on it. Since our intent was to eat and not be entertained I can only rate them average.

data.title: Referee
data.text:
Easy to get to with ample parking 
Very clean both inside and out in the dining areas 
Very friendly staff 
Good food

data.title: We'll be back
data.text: We've eaten frequently at their Champlin location, so we thought we'd give this a try when we were in the area for business. With a couple of new clients in Blaine, we'll be back. The wait staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and just the right amount of attentive. The menu is similar to Champlin's (it might be the same, not sure) but we thought the food was even better. We've been here several times now and the food has been consistently delicious, well prepared, and presented attractively. If you're looking for a burger, sandwich, or down-home cooking, this is the place to go. Delish!

data.title: Burnsville location
data.text: We love the Burnsville location. All the food is really good, and we've been working our way through the menu, trying to get something different each time we visit. My favorite was the Northern, but they only have it as a special every once in awhile - it's not on the regular menu. Patio seating is nice , and there's always popcorn to munch on. We've never been disappointed,  but I've noticed that some of their hot sandwiches need a little more sauce.

data.title: Good spot to meet up with friends
data.text: My first time at Clive's for Happy Hour, we each ordered a drink and an appetizer. I didn't see any wine deals on the Happy Hour menu, so that was disappointing. They do have a small wine menu and offer some wines by the glass. Our food was good, and the service attentive. Most of the crowd was outside where live music was playing, but we were glad to be inside so that we could chat. This restaurant is off Hwy 65, so I would avoid going there during rush hour as Hwy 65 is gridlocked at that time. Finding Clive's in the shopping mall is tricky.

data.title: Fun Atmosphere
data.text: Good beer, excellent service and yummy food.  The wait staff was super busy, but we received our meals within 15 minutes!  Can't wait to go back.

data.title: Oh SO good
data.text: I love coming to Clives. I like to order the same thing every time, but there are still so many other great entrees to try if you wish. The meat is always juicy and fresh. The drinks are good as well, so I've heard.

data.title: Great place for a casual dinner
data.text:
When we walk into Clives Roadhouse, we are always greeted by the friendly staff; usually they even open the door for us when they see us coming. There is ample seating so there is usually not a wait, but if there is a wait, there is a large bar with a decent beer selection. You can call ahead and put your name on a waiting list while you're driving if there is a wait. 
The atmosphere is dark and rustic. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The menu has a lot of options, many of them healthy. I think the turkey burger I usually order is around $10. The beer can be a bit expensive. They have fresh and cooked vegetables available as side dishes, which is important to me. 
The noise level can be pretty loud, so an intimate conversation may not be possible. There is a machine where you can serve yourself free popcorn while you wait for your dinner. This is a great place to grab a bite of great food or bring your whole family. 
They have a lovely outdoor seating area in the summer, and there is often a wait if it's a nice day, but worth the wait.
I highly recommend Clives!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: I have eaten here once , it was very good . I had there mashed potatoe stew , yummy . A nice atmosphere and we were there with s big group . Prices were okay not bad and service was very good , it was awhile ago but the restaurant always looks busy when I drive by , good sign

data.title: Good place to have a drink and dinner
data.text: Not bad food, Dont listen to waitress as they have led me to horrible choices. if you go on your own and pick i had good luck. drinks are nice and patio isnt bad in the summer.

data.title: Maybe we picked the wrong menu items...
data.text: The reviews for this place on Trip Advisor were fairly good, so we decided to give it a try as we shop in this area frequently.  My husband ordered the burger and I ordered the chicken wild rice salad.  Both seemed like safe choices.  My husband said he burger "wasn't bad" and that item separately, he would have given 3 or 4 stars, but the accompanying veggies and dip...were fairly awful.  The veggies looked dry and withered, like something that has been sitting in your fridge for a week with the plastic open.  I had the chicken wild rice salad that was supposed to come with a side piece of bread.  The chicken was extremely skimpy, and it was mostly a tossed salad with wild dress and a sort of vinaigrette dressing and a few golden raisins.  The accompanying bread was a tiny cold piece of buttered and seasoned toast.  Tiny.  I can't tell you how tasteless this salad was.  If I were the chef, I would likely use some kind of toasted sesame dressing, add a few cashews or almonds, and some red or orange peppers for color and taste.  We won't likely eat here ever again.  But I did see the place is always fairly busy so maybe we picked poor choices. It appeared to be a very clean establishment and the service was quick enough.

data.title: Great food but their service is hit or miss.....
data.text:
A group of us visited Clive's twice during the weekend of April 16, 2016, which was the Stick It To Cancer Hockey Tournament.  Our first waitress, Angela P was not good at all.  She looked annoyed and it took forever when we ordered another round of drinks whether it was alcohol or just water.  To her defense, she told someone in our party that she was learning how to deal with parties (large groups), but with as slow as it was there that Sunday afternoon, someone else should've been shadowing her at the very least.  

We all ordered food and when it finally came out, she had forgotten to place orders for 2 of us.  What was really unprofessional was there was no apology from Angela or from the guy who came over to see what the 2 missing orders were.  He asked our group whether everything was ok here and I said "we're missing two plates of food."  His reply was somewhat sarcastic when he said, "well I need to know more than that."  Not professional in the least.  The 2 missing food orders came out a few minutes later.  

Another thing: since this was a large group of hockey players who had just finished playing, we asked for a couple pitchers of water. After 20 minutes, no waters had been delivered.  Instead, Angela brought out separate glasses of water for everyone which took forever. We wanted to stay longer but with it taking 15 minutes or longer to get a drink, we decided to go back to the hotel and enjoy our beverages outside.

Other than the service being incredibly slow with a waitress who seemed annoyed, the food was really good.  I had the smothered steak bites with mashed potatoes and it was fantastic.

Our same group went back that same night so we could watch the Wild game and thankfully, we had a different waitress, Kalee J who was AWESOME.  She was cheerful, professional and was right on top of our group with drinks, food orders, waters, etc.  If it hadn't been for her, I would've rated Clive's much lower.  Kalee J was the saving grace for this place; she was very upbeat and clearly knew what she was doing.  She was fun and took great care of our group.

data.title: Good Food, Great Staff
data.text:
Stopped by for a quick lunch on the way to Anoka Airport. Sat at the bar. Bar staff were really friendly. Ordered the Jambalaya, which was a full deep plate of food. Quite tasty, not over spicy.
I would have liked to have a beer with it, but since I had to fly after lunch, I ordered a Coke instead. However on my next visit, their beer selection seems enough to entice me to come back. See you guys next week!

data.title: Great food. Cool place.
data.text: Service was excellent. Loved the relaxed atmosphere. Food was great. Menu had lots of choices. Poutine was delicious. Burgers and Caesar salad left us all full. Meatloaf burger was unique and yummy. Lots of beer to choose from.
